topics.value: Welcome test and single entry -determination of opening and closing capital

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] explain capital Ii] determine opening and closing capital Iii] deduce profit or loss made

learningActivities.value: Students as a class explain capital -students in pairs determine the capital -students as a class determine the profit or loss

embeddedCoreSkills.value: -critical thinking and problem solving -collaboration and communication -leadership and personal development

topics.value: Single entry incomplete records Determination of profit or loss from statement of affairs Preparations of trading , profit or loss accounts and balance sheets from incomplete records Convention of single entry to double entry steps to conversion

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] determine the profit; or loss using statement of affairs Ii] prepare trading profit & loss account and balance sheets Iii] itemize the steps of conversion from single entry to double entry

learningActivities.value: -students in small groups make presentation on the rules of double entry system -students in  small groups, apply the rules of conversion from single to double entry and make presentations -students in pairs display preparation of financial statement

embeddedCoreSkills.value: Critical thinking and problem solving -collaboration and communication -leadership and personal development

topics.value: Accounts of non-profit making organization Meaning terminologies, receipts and payments account features and format

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] define accounts of non-profit making organizations Ii]give examples of clubs and societies in your school Iii] explain receipt and payment account

topics.value: Working exercises on receipts and payments accounts Demonstration of accumulate fund and treatment of subscriptions and other normal ledgers in arrears and in advance
using Excel to prepare Receipt and payment account

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] write out the procedure for determination of accumulated fund Ii] explain subscriptions Ii] prepare receipts and payments account
Iii] give the similarities of receipts & payment and income & expenditure account Iv] distinguish between receipts & payment account and income & expenditure

learningActivities.value: Students as a class write out the procedure for determination of accumulated fund Ii] explain subscriptions Iii] prepare receipts and payment account

embeddedCoreSkills.value: -collaboration and communication   Leadership and personal development   Digital literacy

topics.value: Receipts and payments account,  income and expenditure account Meaning , rules similarities and differences between receipts and payments account and  income and expenditure

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] recall the meaning of income and expenditure account Ii] state the rules for receipts & payments accounts and income & expenditure account

learningActivities.value: Students as a class, mention the accounts prepare by not-for profit making  organization Students in  small groups, explain each of the accounts mentioned Students in small
Groups make presentation on the differences between the account mentioned

embeddedCoreSkills.value: Critical thinking and problem solving Collaboration and communication Leadership and personal development

learningResources.value: using Excel to prepare Receipt and payment account

topics.value: Presentation of income & expenditure account and balance sheet with working exercises

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] identify the procedures involved in the preparation income and expenditure account draw up income and expenditure account Ii] determine the surplus or deficit from the account Iii] prepare balance sheet

learningActivities.value: Students as a class state the procedures for positing items to income and expenditure accounts Students in pairs follow the procedures to prepare income and expenditure accounts and balance sheetsStudents as a class determine surplus and deficit

embeddedCoreSkills.value: -critical thinking and problem solving -leadership and personal development

topics.value: Introduction to partnership account -meaning types of partnership -partnership deeds/agreement terminologies

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] define partnership account Ii] differentiate between fixed/current method and fluctuating method of preparing partner’s account

learningActivities.value: Students  as a class explain the  formation of partnership business Students are grouped to different classes of partners Students in pairs differentiate between fixed and fluctuating capital accounting

embeddedCoreSkills.value: Collaboration and communication Critical thinking and problem solving Leadership and personal development

topics.value: Partnership account partners capital account -partners appropriate  account Format and working exercises

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] prepare partnership account Ii] differentiate between fixed /current method of preparing partner’s account

learningActivities.value: Students as a class mention the accounts to be prepared in a partnership business Students in pair, explain each of the accounts mentioned Students in small groups make presentation on differences between each  of the accounts

embeddedCoreSkills.value: Collaboration and communication Critical thinking and problem solving Leadership and personal development

topics.value: Collaboration and communication Critical thinking and problem solving Leadership and personal development

learningObjectives.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: I] prepare partnership goodwill account after the admission of partners Ii]interpret the concept of goodwill

learningActivities.value: Students  as a class explain the circumstance for the admission of new partners Students in pairs mention the account involve on admission of new partners
Students in small groups make presentations on goodwill and its circumstances

embeddedCoreSkills.value: Collaboration and communicationCritical thinking and problem solving Leadership and personal development
